title: Los Angeles immigration protesters rolling to Arizona
body:
LOS ANGELES   Hundreds of Southern Californians are rolling to Arizona this morning to protest the state's new 
immigration law, a day after a federal judge put its key measures on hold.

Nearly a dozen chartered carrying immigrant-rights activists left Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles for the ride to 
Phoenix.

The new law taking effect Thursday was designed to crack down on illegal immigration but critics say it 
encourages racism against Hispanics.

A federal judge in Phoenix on Wednesday issued a temporary injunction delaying the most contentious provisions, 
including a requirement that immigrants carry their papers and that police check a person's immigration status 
while enforcing other laws.

Arizona's governor says she'll appeal the ruling.
